Block SolverÔÉÅ

This function builds a block preconditioner P for ksp solve of matrix A:

Let ksp(A, P) means a Krylov solve of matrix A with preconditioner P

Define a block matrix system A as

    A = [ A00, A01
          A10, A11 ]

Composite type options are:

    additive: P = [ksp(A00,Ap00), 0
                   0            , ksp(A11,Ap11)]

    multiplicative: P = J.K.L
        where J = [I, 0
                   0, ksp(A11,Ap11)]

              K = [0, 0    +   [ I  , 0     *[I, 0        (see PETSc's doc page for details here)
                   0, I]        -A10, -A11]   0, 0]

              L = [ksp(A00,Ap00), 0
                   0            , I]

    symmetric_multiplicative: (see PETSc's doc page. This is too big)

    schur: (schur complement decomposition, see doc page)

Set the field names for this node. Each field name is equivalent to the tag of a PhysicsProblem in the flatiron_tk framework

Parameters:ÔÉÅ

Sets:ÔÉÅ

_field_tags (tuple): A tuple of field names. _node_tag (str): A string that concatenates the field names with an underscore.

class flatiron_tk.solver.block_solver.BlockSplitTree(physics, splits)[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A class to manage a block split tree for building block preconditioners.

Parameters:

  • (PhysicsProblem) (physics)

  • Iterable[dict]) (splits (dict or) ‚Äì

    splits. Each dictionary should have the following keys:

    • ‚Äôfields‚Äô: A list of two lists, each containing field tags to be grouped together.

    • ‚Äôcomposite_type‚Äô: The type of composite preconditioner to use (‚Äòadditive‚Äô, ‚Äòmultiplicative‚Äô,

      ‚Äôsymmetric_multiplicative‚Äô, ‚Äòschur‚Äô, ‚Äòspecial‚Äô).

    • ‚Äôschur_fact_type‚Äô (optional): The Schur factorization type if ‚Äòcomposite_type‚Äô is ‚Äòschur‚Äô

      (‚Äòdiag‚Äô, ‚Äòfull‚Äô, ‚Äòlower‚Äô, ‚Äòupper‚Äô).

    • ‚Äôschur_pre_type‚Äô (optional): The Schur preconditioner type if ‚Äòcomposite_type‚Äô is ‚Äòschur‚Äô

      (‚Äòa11‚Äô, ‚Äòfull‚Äô, ‚Äòself‚Äô, ‚Äòselfp‚Äô, ‚Äòuser‚Äô).

    • ‚Äôksp0_set_function‚Äô (optional): A function to set up the KSP for the first block.

    • ‚Äôksp1_set_function‚Äô (optional): A function to set up the KSP for the second block.

Build the block split preconditioner for the given blocks.

Parameters:

  • (Iterable[str]) (blocks_1)

  • (Iterable[str])

  • (tuple) (is1_data)

  • (tuple)

  • (str) (schur_pre_type) ‚Äì Options: ‚Äòadditive‚Äô, ‚Äòmultiplicative‚Äô, ‚Äòsymmetric_multiplicative‚Äô, ‚Äòschur‚Äô, ‚Äòspecial‚Äô. Default is ‚Äòadditive‚Äô.

  • (str) ‚Äì is ‚Äòschur‚Äô. Options: ‚Äòdiag‚Äô, ‚Äòfull‚Äô, ‚Äòlower‚Äô, ‚Äòupper‚Äô. Default is ‚Äòfull‚Äô.

  • (str) ‚Äì is ‚Äòschur‚Äô. Options: ‚Äòa11‚Äô, ‚Äòfull‚Äô, ‚Äòself‚Äô, ‚Äòselfp‚Äô, ‚Äòuser‚Äô. Default is ‚Äòa11‚Äô.

Returns:

PETSc.KSP

Return type:

The KSP object for the block split preconditioner.
